qas.question: The crown tribunal was created when?
What was the crown tribunal supposed to do?

answers.text: reduce the enormous pressure on the Royal Court

qas.question: Where was a lot of power placed in result of the crown tribunal?
WHo joined the crown tribunal eventually?

context: In <a0_0>1578<a0_0/> <a1_0>king Stefan Batory<a1_0/> created the Crown Tribunal in order to <a2_0>reduce the enormous pressure on the Royal Court<a2_0/>. This placed much of the monarch's juridical power in the hands of the elected szlachta deputies, further strengthening <a3_0>the nobility class<a3_0/>. In 1581 the Crown Tribunal was joined by a counterpart in Lithuania, the <a4_0>Lithuanian Tribunal<a4_0/>.
